levels.name: level-00
levels.description: Essential security fundamentals for newcomers - start your cybersecurity journey with the most common web vulnerabilities

labs.name: xss-1
labs.description: A modern user profile management platform with a critical reflected XSS vulnerability. Learn how malicious scripts can be injected into web applications and executed in victims' browsers, potentially stealing cookies, session tokens, or performing actions on behalf of users.

labs.name: ssrf-1
labs.description: A professional asset loading service that fetches external resources for web applications. This service contains a critical SSRF vulnerability that allows attackers to make the server perform requests to internal network resources, potentially exposing sensitive data or services not meant to be accessible externally.

labs.name: auth-1
labs.description: A modern enterprise portal using cookie-based authentication with a critical flaw in token generation. The application uses predictable authentication tokens that can be manipulated by attackers to impersonate other users, including administrative accounts.

labs.name: autho-1
labs.description: A professional information management platform with user authentication and content access controls. The application contains a critical authorization flaw that allows authenticated users to access restricted information by manipulating URL parameters, bypassing intended access controls.

labs.name: codex-1
labs.description: An advanced code processing system designed for development environments. This professional application features dynamic text processing capabilities with a critical vulnerability in input validation that allows remote code execution through carefully crafted expressions.

levels.name: level-01
levels.description: Core vulnerability exploitation techniques - build practical skills with real-world attack scenarios

labs.name: cve-2014-6271
labs.description: A system monitoring dashboard running CGI scripts vulnerable to the infamous Shellshock bash bug. This critical vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands by manipulating environment variables, affecting millions of systems worldwide when discovered in 2014.

labs.name: jwt-1
labs.description: A secure-looking web application using JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication, but with a fatal flaw in algorithm verification. Learn how attackers can exploit the 'none' algorithm or algorithm confusion to forge valid tokens and bypass authentication mechanisms entirely.

labs.name: sqli-1
labs.description: A feature-rich news portal with user authentication and content management, containing classic SQL injection vulnerabilities. Master the fundamentals of database manipulation through malicious SQL queries, from basic data extraction to achieving administrative access.
labs.objective: Extract admin credentials via SQL injection

labs.name: pickle
labs.description: A Python web application using pickle for session serialization - a dangerous practice that enables remote code execution. Learn how Python's pickle module can be weaponized to execute arbitrary code when deserializing untrusted data, a common issue in Python applications.

levels.name: level-02
levels.description: Advanced exploitation scenarios - tackle complex vulnerabilities and sophisticated attack chains used by real threat actors

labs.name: cve-2016-10033
labs.description: A professional contact form using a vulnerable version of PHPMailer, the world's most popular PHP email library. This critical vulnerability allows command injection through email headers, affecting countless websites that relied on PHPMailer for email functionality before the 2016 security patches.

labs.name: jwt-2
labs.description: An enterprise-grade application with enhanced JWT security measures, but still vulnerable to sophisticated algorithm confusion attacks. This lab teaches advanced JWT manipulation techniques, including RS256 to HS256 confusion attacks and key extraction methods used in real-world scenarios.
